Make your restaurant transactions easily recognizable! \n\nType in your bill amount and ideal tip percentage and we calculate your total using our secure pattern.
See the about page for a description of the pattern! \n\nTap to get started!

In short, palindrome tipping is the secure way to tip. 

 When you pay for a meal using a credit card, there is an opportunity for anyone handling your receipt to commit fraud and modify your written tip and total amounts. The only way to combat this is to keep a receipt and then compare the charge once it posts to your account. 

 Palindrome tipping offers a calculation method that will make noticing these fraudulent charges very easy. 

 We calculate your total normally using your preferred tipping percentage and then apply the palindrome pattern. The pattern is simply mirroring the numbers in the ones and tens place and setting that mirrored amount on the right side of the decimal.

Since we are altering the total we include a message telling you the actual tip percentage used.

The power of palindrome tipping lies in creating a pattern for your total that you will be able to instantly recognize when scanning your credit card statement. 

 If you notice a charge to your credit card from a restaurant and it does not follow the palindrome pattern then you know that your intended total was altered.

Due to each whole dollar value corresponding to a single palindrome pattern ($3.00 = $3.30, $10.00 = $10.01, $134.00 = $134.43, etc..), at low amounts (usually less than $10), you can run into large amounts of rounding to reach a palindrome pattern that is greater than the original bill. 

 Bill: $1.15 
 Tip at 17 percent: $0.20 
 Total: $1.35 
 
To make this total follow the palindrome pattern we would need to round the total up to $2.20 since rounding down to $1.10 would be less than the original bill. Rounding to a total of $2.20 would mean a 91 percent tip of $1.05! 

 The pattern also does not work for any amount less than $1.00 because there is nothing to mirror ($0.23 mirrored is $0.00). In these cases you can switch to normal tipping from settings.
